conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway/isometric 3D model: walls extruded with visible thickness, multiple wall faces (top/side) visible, interior volumes readable, and ceiling/roof removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall height/thickness and readable corner geometry; isometric-like camera and clean cutaway. Minor simplifications in wall detailing/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches (living/dining core, kitchen+utility to left/bottom, bedroom wing to right). Some room/bath subdivisions and proportional relationships appear simplified versus the 2D plan, and not all openings/partitions are clearly verifiable as exact.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (living seating, dining table, beds) and kitchen/bath fixtures exist, but some fixtures/room-specific detailing (e.g., dress/toilet segmentation) appears generalized.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with good contrast and lighting. Room text labels are present (UI contamination) and slightly reduce presentation cleanliness; glazing/wall materials sometimes reduce edge clarity.

detected_errors.description: Some room proportions and internal partitioning (notably bathroom/dress/ancillary segmentation) appear simplified compared to the 2D plan, reducing strict layout fidelity.
Doors/windows/opening placements are not fully traceable to the 2D plan; several openings look generalized or not clearly aligned to specific walls.
Text labels are visible in the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness per rubric.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong spatial readability and mostly faithful layout, but with noticeable simplification in partitions/proportions and non-verifiable door/window accuracy.
